In a further bizarre twist, Abby later finds what seems to be a new video on her computer - and the case takes on fresh urgency with the discovery that it is actually a live feed, suggesting the murderer is somewhere on the premises.(n)

programme.title: Heart of the Country
programme.desc: The wife of a Wall Street stockbroker finds her glamorous existence brought crashing to a halt when her husband is imprisoned for fraud. Forced to return to rural North Carolina where she grew up, she attempts to make peace with her estranged father and deal with unresolved issues surrounding the death of her mother. Drama, starring Jana Kramer and Gerald McRaney.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sonya and Toadie's first counselling session since their separation gets off to an awkward start. Jack is disappointed at Paige's refusal to allow Steph to spend any time with Gabe.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Hunter comes clean to Irene about his part in the diner robbery, Justin takes action when another private detective finds Scarlett, and Irene and Marilyn try to cheer up Kat.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: MotoGP Highlights
programme.desc: The Grand Prix of Austria. Action from the 11th meeting of the season, staged at the Spielberg Red Bull Ring. The undulating terrain and naturally created arena are trademark features of the circuit, along with its 18-metre-high landmark Bull of Spielberg statue in its centre.(n)

programme.title: All New Traffic Cops
programme.desc: North Yorkshire officers are called out to a massive crash near a theme park that has resulted in the death of at least one person. The need to understand what has happened and who - if anyone - is to blame tests the resources of all the traffic cops who attend and then investigate this fatal incident. Will their gut instincts that this is a drug-fuelled disaster prove correct?.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Marcus Bentley narrates as the housemates lie in their beds, chat on the sofas and argue in the kitchen - all for the enjoyment of the viewers. Will they find being watched by Big Brother's cameras any harder to cope with than life in the public eye?.(n)

programme.title: Make or Break
programme.desc: Stephen dishes out some home truths to Elle, but her reaction proves to be more than he bargained for. Karl is left dumbstruck when Holly receives a visitor from home, and Andy faces up to his darker issues.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the CBB companion show, featuring gossip, chat and features from the house. Including a debate on the burning issues, celebrity guests' thoughts on the latest developments and behind-the-scenes insights.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Botched Up Bodies
programme.desc: Sophie Kasaei of Geordie Shore fame was offered a cut-price filler to give her a sexy pout - but when her lips reacted to the unknown substance she was forced to have it removed and now she seeks advice to find out if there has been any long-term damage. Former Big Brother contestant Aisleyne Horgan-Wallace has been left with slanting dentures after dental surgery to improve her broken teeth. Can surgeon Adam Slade give her back her smile? Plus, after three breast enhancements, Life on Marbs star Danni Levy visits surgeon Paul Harris to sort her odd-sized boobs.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.sub-title: The Hotel Inspector Abroad: La Casa Hotel, Torrox.
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi pays a visit to La Casa Hotel in the village of Torrox Pueblo near Malaga in southern Spain, where a number of factors have led to a room occupancy rate of just 25 per cent. With little prospect of selling up and moving back home, sisters Sarah and Karen have no choice but to try to make the hotel work, but a drop in tourist numbers and the collapse of the Spanish economy in 2012 have saddled the pair with debts, leaving Alex with a huge task on her hands to turn around their fortunes.(n)

programme.title: Get Your Tatts Out: Kavos Ink
programme.desc: Three strip-club workers have a contest to drum up more business, with the loser having a mammary-based reminder of his failure sketched onto his leg. Holiday-maker Nelson has his pals' names inked on his backside, while another comes up with a design representing his favourite body part.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers advice to the owners of a four-bedroom house in the picturesque Hampshire market town of Petersfield, who are having difficulty selling their home for the asking price of £450,000.(n)

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Paul Binski, Professor of the History of Medieval Art at Cambridge University, visits Chelsea's Gothic-revival Holy Trinity Church designed by John Dando Sedding, and William Lethaby's thatched All Saints' Church in Brockhampton, Herefordshire, which boasts fittings by William Morris and Edward Burne-Jones of the Arts and Crafts movement.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Poppy Cat
programme.desc: Zuzu accidentally spoils Owl's favourite painting, and then tries to hide it by suggesting everyone should head into the jungle to meet the artist in person.(n)

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: Children's animation following the adventures of a family of puffins living on a wild and beautiful Irish island. Narrated by Chris O'Dowd.(n)

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Gaspard and Simon help their dad prepare a surprise birthday party for their mummy, but they need to hurry, as she is on her way home from the office.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: The team tries to help Chef Tattie prepare for the Spring City Food Festival, but Tread takes on too many jobs at once, and starts to mess up his deliveries.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Bronwen stages a synchronised swimming exhibition to mark the grand re-opening of the Pontypandy lido, but Norman threatens to ruin the occasion when he accidentally starts a fire.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Thomas discovers tough-guy Diesel has a soft spot for baby ducklings, and the gruff engine agrees to be nicer to everyone so long as his secret remains hidden.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet is determined to become a member of a ship's crew and accepts an interesting challenge.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: The girls meet a Lightning Genie and help him catch his bolt.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: The Case of the Stolen Treasure.
programme.desc: The pirates spring clean their galleon - much to the annoyance of Pirate Stripes, who wants to go on a treasure hunt. Later that day, the pirate treasure disappears.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Gold is discovered in Adventure Bay, but Mayor Humdinger and the Kit-tastrophe Crew soon find a chance to make off with it.(n)

programme.title: Rusty Rivets
programme.desc: When there's a job to do and the stakes are high, ten-year-old Rusty Rivets invents his way out of every jam by repurposing parts and objects into the wildest, greatest contraptions ever!.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Mungo crashes and forgets how to fly, so Digby resolves to teach him how to take to the skies again.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is time to show off Mummy Pig's newly finished book to Peppa's friends. However, Peppa and George lose some of the book while they are playing.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig visits Peppa and George and brings seeds for them to plant, while Daddy Pig acts as a scarecrow.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: A lost sheet of beautiful music falls at Mofy and Kerry's feet, so they set out to reunite the score with its elusive feathered composer.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Mrs Figg's magic school is damaged, so a cake stall is organised to raise money for repairs, but no one can eat Queen Thistle's cakes.(n)

programme.title: Floogals
programme.desc: The trio are baffled to learn that the huge flowers they can see in the garden are grown from tiny seeds.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Julian Norton receives an emergency call from alpaca breeder Jackie, whose prize-winning female Cinderella is pregnant and struggling with a difficult labour. Back at the practice, Peter Wright is dealing with Larry the chinchilla, who is responsible for a population explosion and needs to be castrated, while Dougie the petulant parrot is due for a beak and nail trim.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Marcus Bentley narrates as the housemates lie in their beds, chat on the sofas and argue in the kitchen - all for the enjoyment of the viewers. Will they find being watched by Big Brother's cameras any harder to cope with than life in the public eye?.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin lends Scarlett his car to get away from Anderson and she opens up about her son's death. Ash invites Tori over for lunch and VJ plays peacemaker between Hunter and Peggy.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Amy discovers that her new doctor friend is Terese's villainous brother Nick. Fay tells Tyler, Mark and Aaron that their father is seriously ill and wants to see them.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bank at Quantico is robbed and a security guard killed, but the team soon discovers that stealing money may not have been the perpetrators' primary objective. Meanwhile, Gibbs is given the task of evaluating an inexperienced new agent assigned by Vance to help investigate the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rey Valentin.(n)

programme.title: I Didn't Kill My Sister
programme.desc: Heather works as an assistant to her news presenter sister Carmen but never seems to get a break of her own. Nevertheless she is there to pick up the pieces when the more successful sibling's marriage breaks down - only to be accused of murder when Carmen is found dead. Thriller, starring Nicholle Tom, Gina Holden and Chris William Martin.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Amy discovers that her new doctor friend is Terese's villainous brother Nick. Fay tells Tyler, Mark and Aaron that their father is seriously ill and wants to see them.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin lends Scarlett his car to get away from Anderson and she opens up about her son's death. Ash invites Tori over for lunch and VJ plays peacemaker between Hunter and Peggy.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: Engineer Rob Bell tells the story behind the design and construction of Isambard Kingdom Brunel's famous bridge over the picturesque Avon gorge at Bristol, and discovers that some people question whether it was entirely the product of his own devising. The bridge remained unfinished in Brunel's lifetime, but when he died in 1859, his friends decided that the bridge should be completed as a memorial, using the chains from another of his suspension bridges that was being demolished.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers with Alan Davies
programme.desc: Inspector Kate Ford becomes worried about a staffie-cross that appears to be dangerously underweight. The owner claims to regularly feed the dog, and Kate is desperate to get an appointment with a vet, which proves to be no easy task. At Block Fen RSPCA, staff work to rehabilitate a lurcher that was tied to a fence and abandoned, and a trainee police dog competes against more experienced sniffer hounds in a mission to locate concealed firearms.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents the latest eviction show, announcing the least popular housemate and chatting to them about their time in the house and how they got on with their fellow contestants. There's also the usual round-up of yesterday's action.(n)

programme.title: Make or Break
programme.desc: The participants continue their quest to determine whether they are currently dating the `one', but things are becoming increasingly personal between the couples. Jess makes an unusual discovery that could result in a few awkward conversations with conquests past and present, and Matty tells Andy precisely what he thinks of him. Plus, Karl makes a potentially catastrophic relationship blunder.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the CBB companion show, featuring gossip, chat and features from the house. Including a debate on the burning issues, celebrity guests' thoughts on the latest developments and behind-the-scenes insights.(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Blinded by toxic waste as a child, Matt Murdock develops superhuman awareness and balance which enable him to tackle New York's worst villains(n)

programme.title: Miss March
programme.desc: Zach Cregger and Trevor Moore wrote, directed and star in this uproarious road romp about a young man (Cregger) who's been in a coma for four years and awakens to discover that his chaste high-school sweetheart is now a men's-magazine centerfold, so he sets off to reconnect with her and consummate their relationship. Moore plays his horn-dog best friend who is with him every step of the zany way. Raquel Alessi, Craig Robinson, Alexis Raben, Eve Mauro. Hugh Hefner has a cameo as himself(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: Martha finally finds her Mr. Right, but he has just one flaw: he is a hitman on the run from his former employers, a crime cartel(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two longtime friends take stock of their accomplished artistic careers in this meditative drama written and directed by Paolo Sorrentino. Michael Caine stars as Fred Ballinger, a retired composer who, at the behest of his daughter (Rachel Weisz), is on vacation in the Alps with his friend Mick Boyle (Harvey Keitel), a filmmaker currently working on a new project. Fred believes he is enjoying his retirement, but he is soon approached with an offer of a British knighthood if he'll conduct a performance of a famous piece he wrote(n)

programme.title: Fierce People
programme.desc: Actor-turned-director and producer Griffin Dunne (Practical Magic, Addicted to Love) teams up with scenarist Dirk Wittenborn for the slice-of-life ensemble drama Fierce People. As summer encroaches, 16-year-old Manhattanite Finn Earl (Anton Yelchin) would love nothing more than to trek off to South America and spend the year's sun-drenched months near the equator, embarking on thrilling adventures with his estranged archaeologist father, whom he's never met. Alas, the bonds of family rein in tight when Finn's booze- and coke-addled mother, the masseuse Liz (Diane Lane), cries out for help -- and, in the process, unwittingly gets Finn arrested. In a dramatic attempt to reverse circumstances and sort out the complications in both of their lives, Liz insists on taking custody of Finn for the summer. Both, she insists, will live in the home of one of her former massage clients, the aging billionaire Ogden C. Osborne (Donald Sutherland) -- with whom she may be amorously involved. Though Finn agrees begrudgingly at first, in time he finds the environment welcoming -- as he develops a crush on Ogden's gorgeous granddaughter (Kristen Stewart) and befriends Ogden's grandson. But when an unforeseen and shocking act of violence erupts, it estranges Finn and Liz from their posh surroundings and provides a sobering, harrowing reminder of the socioeconomic differences between the Earls and their new friends(n)

programme.title: The Color of Money
programme.desc: Paul Newman racked up an Oscar reprising his role from "The Hustler", a pool shark who takes a hotshot under his wing(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A thief enlists the help of mythical Egyptian gods to overthrow a vicious ruler(n)

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: (2010) Michael Cera (Juno, Superbad) stars in this unconventionally structured, inventive and comic paean to the alternate universe of manga and computer gaming. The movie is based on an acclaimed series of graphic novels by Canadian cartoonist Bryan Lee O'Malley, and is directed by British film-maker Edgar Wright (Shaun of the Dead, Channel 4's TV series Spaced), here making his Hollywood debut. Computer game fanatic Scott Pilgrim (Cera) is the bass player with Toronto band Sex Bob-omb. He shares his flat with his slightly-out-of-control gay friend Wallace Wells (Kieran Culkin), and courts a little controversy by dating 17-year-old schoolgirl Knives Chau (Ellen Wong). However, theirs is a fairly platonic relationship, and one he's prepared to ditch the moment he sets eyes on the woman (literally) of his dreams: Ramona Flowers (Mary Elizabeth Winstead). But if Scott wants to capture the impossibly cool New Yorker's heart, he must first defeat her former lovers, the Seven Evil Exes, in video game end-level-style combat. So he embarks on a kinetic, romantic quest, largely conducted within his own head, replete with slapstick violence, impressive effects and witty retorts(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Comedy about a failed actor turned drama teacher who, in a final and deluded attempt to make an impact, sets about creating a controversial and 'inspirational' sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In the next installment of the "Maze Runner" franchise Thomas (Dylan O'Brien), Teresa (Kaya Scodelario) and the rest of the Gladers search for clues about WCKD, a powerful organization in the Scorch, a bleak landscape that is filled with dangerous obstacles. The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. Directed by Wes Ball who previously directed the original film, The Maze Runner. Cast includes Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Giancarlo Esposito, Aidan Gillen, Ki Hong Lee, Barry Pepper, Lili Taylor and Patricia Clarkson(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: A young stud who is going nowhere fast in small-town Texas heads for New York in this classic downbeat drama which took the Oscar for best picture. On the sleazy streets of the Big Apple, Joe Buck's dreams of finding glamour and adventure are shattered by a succession of unsavoury incidents, but he finds a friend in the unlikely shape of 'Ratso' Rizzo, a street hustler with a wasting lung disease(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: A group of death row prison guards discover there's more to an unusual new inmate than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this clever, offbeat Western(n)

programme.title: Master Of The Shadowless Kick: Wong Kei-ying
Mafia!
programme.desc: Takeoff on the Godfather with the son of a mafia king taking over for his dying father(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Three New York drag queens travel cross-country on their way to Hollywood, but a broken-down car strands them in a narrow-minded Midwestern town, where they share makeup tips with the ladies and show the hostile men how to treat women right(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: Philip Seymour Hoffman won a much-deserved Best Actor Oscar for his uncannily astounding performance as "In Cold Blood" author Truman Capote. The exceptional biopic spans the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece. Catherine Keener received a Best Supporting Oscar nod as Capote's friend and researcher Harper Lee, who a few years later would publish "To Kill a Mockingbird." Dan Futterman's script was also Oscar-nominated. Clifton Collins Jr., Chris Cooper, Bob Balaban, Amy Ryan(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Based upon Mark Millar's explosive graphic novel series and helmed by stunning visualist director Timur Bekmambetov, Wanted stars Academy Award-winners Angelina Jolie and Morgan Freeman as members of a secret fraternity of assassins. James McAvoy portrays a slacker who is unexpectedly recruited to join the ranks of these elite fighters. As his powers and skills increase under their tutelage, however, he begins to waver between heroism and vengeance, and discovers that there is more to his dangerous associates than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: After walking in on his girlfriend cheating, lawyer Mitch sets up home near the local college. It's just the chance his thirtysomething pals have been waiting for: they turn his new house into a 24-hour party house(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: In northern Australia at the beginning of World War II, an English aristocrat inherits a cattle station the size of Maryland. When English cattle barons plot to take her land, she reluctantly joins forces with a rough-hewn stock-man to drive 2,000 head of cattle across hundreds of miles of the country's most unforgiving land, only to still face the bombing of Darwin, Australia, by the Japanese forces that had attacked Pearl Harbor only months earlier(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this charming sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit, Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: National Security
programme.desc: The mismatched cops variation of the buddy comedy genre gets taken out of mothballs for this farce directed by longtime Adam Sandler collaborator Dennis Dugan. Martin Lawrence and Steve Zahn star, respectively, as Earl Montgomery, a loudmouthed police academy reject, and Hank Rafferty, a mild-mannered cop who is disgraced and dismissed from his job. Having met once before on a traffic stop, the two men are less than thrilled to be paired together as security guards. When the two men discover a complex smuggling scheme, however, they put aside their animosity to investigate the criminal scheme. They soon learn that the illegal enterprise involves a mastermind named Nash (Eric Roberts) and a new, virtually indestructible metal that's worth a fortune. Unable to persuade Hank's former police department superiors that they're onto a huge case, the two partners must devise a way to expose the sophisticated scam and bring down Nash on their own. National Security co-stars Colm Feore, Bill Duke, Timothy Busfield, and Wayne Knight(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Two straight-laced friends pose as drug dealers and try their best -- and sometimes fail -- to fit in with the thug circle in order to retrieve a stolen kitten(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: Two-time Academy Award winner Tom Hanks delivers an outstanding performance in this excellent Oscar winning Drama. Chuck Noland is a Fed-Ex manager who demands that everything must be on time and travels the world to make sure punctuality is on top of everything else. He has a girlfriend, Kelly, with whom he is deeply in love with and family he hardly sees. When work intrudes on Christmas Eve, Chuck has a quick gift exchange in the car and kisses Kelly goodbye. He boards a delivery plane going overseas which gets caught in a horrendous storm and crashes into the Pacific. The sole survivor Chuck washes up on a remote island along with several Fed-Ex packages that he must use for supplies. With limited luxury, he adapts to the island over the course of 1,500 nights(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a group of extreme athletes who are using their specialized skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. Remake of the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Blinded by toxic waste as a child, Matt Murdock develops superhuman awareness and balance which enable him to tackle New York's worst villains(n)

programme.title: Miss March
programme.desc: Zach Cregger and Trevor Moore wrote, directed and star in this uproarious road romp about a young man (Cregger) who's been in a coma for four years and awakens to discover that his chaste high-school sweetheart is now a men's-magazine centerfold, so he sets off to reconnect with her and consummate their relationship. Moore plays his horn-dog best friend who is with him every step of the zany way. Raquel Alessi, Craig Robinson, Alexis Raben, Eve Mauro. Hugh Hefner has a cameo as himself(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: Philip Seymour Hoffman won a much-deserved Best Actor Oscar for his uncannily astounding performance as "In Cold Blood" author Truman Capote. The exceptional biopic spans the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece. Catherine Keener received a Best Supporting Oscar nod as Capote's friend and researcher Harper Lee, who a few years later would publish "To Kill a Mockingbird." Dan Futterman's script was also Oscar-nominated. Clifton Collins Jr., Chris Cooper, Bob Balaban, Amy Ryan(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Based upon Mark Millar's explosive graphic novel series and helmed by stunning visualist director Timur Bekmambetov, Wanted stars Academy Award-winners Angelina Jolie and Morgan Freeman as members of a secret fraternity of assassins. James McAvoy portrays a slacker who is unexpectedly recruited to join the ranks of these elite fighters. As his powers and skills increase under their tutelage, however, he begins to waver between heroism and vengeance, and discovers that there is more to his dangerous associates than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: In northern Australia at the beginning of World War II, an English aristocrat inherits a cattle station the size of Maryland. When English cattle barons plot to take her land, she reluctantly joins forces with a rough-hewn stock-man to drive 2,000 head of cattle across hundreds of miles of the country's most unforgiving land, only to still face the bombing of Darwin, Australia, by the Japanese forces that had attacked Pearl Harbor only months earlier(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2

programme.title: National Security
programme.desc: The mismatched cops variation of the buddy comedy genre gets taken out of mothballs for this farce directed by longtime Adam Sandler collaborator Dennis Dugan. Martin Lawrence and Steve Zahn star, respectively, as Earl Montgomery, a loudmouthed police academy reject, and Hank Rafferty, a mild-mannered cop who is disgraced and dismissed from his job. Having met once before on a traffic stop, the two men are less than thrilled to be paired together as security guards. When the two men discover a complex smuggling scheme, however, they put aside their animosity to investigate the criminal scheme. They soon learn that the illegal enterprise involves a mastermind named Nash (Eric Roberts) and a new, virtually indestructible metal that's worth a fortune. Unable to persuade Hank's former police department superiors that they're onto a huge case, the two partners must devise a way to expose the sophisticated scam and bring down Nash on their own. National Security co-stars Colm Feore, Bill Duke, Timothy Busfield, and Wayne Knight(n)

programme.desc: Comedy drama set in the 1940s big-band scene, starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part series finale, bringing to an end Britain's longest-running police procedural drama, which has been broadcast in 55 countries. The show, which began life as one-off drama Woodentop in 1984, broke new ground by exploring the lives and loves of the officers of the fictional London station of Sun Hill. Callum finally proves himself to Smithy as they hunt the members of the Parkway Crew responsible for the death of Liam Martin, and Mickey goes all-out to get justice for his informant Jasmine Harris following the gang rape.(n)

programme.desc: Sandra and the team investigate why five years earlier a man seemingly vanished during his morning run and has not been seen since. Crime drama, starring Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Nicholas Farrell.(n)

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia(n)

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia(n)

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted--or rather, refereed--by boxing expert Max Kellerman, this lively cable-TV discussion show featured four sports columnists, each from a different part of the USA, discussing recent pro-athletic developments in a sort of electronic summit meeting. Kellerman determined how much time each of the columnists would be permitted to express his or her opinions--and he was harsh indeed, frequently limiting the discourse to ten seconds or less. At the end of the show, Kellerman would award points for the most cogent opinions and arguments, and also subtract points from contributors whom he determined had not effectively expressed themselves. The inagural episode of ESPN's Around the Horn was seen on September 30, 2002(n)

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Mike Wilbon face off in this half-hour debate. The journalists take two minutes to argue each point, and haggle their way through a variety of sports news(n)

programme.title: SportsNation
programme.desc: ESPN Radio personality Colin Cowherd and Michelle Beadle host this sports talk show that's powered by the fans. The topics covered in this weekday show are chosen by fans voting on ESPN.com's SportsNation site(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The crew embarks on a journey through the Mediterranean Sea, whose coasts are among the most densely populated in the world, to explore the profound effect man has had on the body of water. Paul Rose and the team also visit the remains of a Roman shipwreck and, under the cover of night, dive the Straits of Messina, hoping to find and film the sixgill shark - one of the largest predatory sharks in the world.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age Giants
programme.desc: Alice Roberts examines the latest discoveries from the northern hemisphere to shed light on the lives and habitats of the creatures that dominated the planet 40,000 years ago. She begins by heading to North America, which was home to a diverse group of giant mammals, and discovers how the sabre-toothed cat's out-sized teeth were vital for hunting, yet easily broken. Alice looks at evidence of the bear-sized Shasta ground sloth in a cave in the Grand Canyon, and learns about the strange armadillo-like glyptodont - which was the size of a small car.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: In the waters off the coast of Borneo, Steve Backshall comes face to face with a venomous scorpion fish and witnesses the spear-mantis impaling its supper.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall searches for lethal wildlife in the UK, and has a diving competition with gannets at sea. He also meets the only species of snake to have hospitalised him, studies a nest of hornets and is hunted through a forest by a goshawk.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses `fly' with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The crew embarks on a journey through the Mediterranean Sea, whose coasts are among the most densely populated in the world, to explore the profound effect man has had on the body of water. Paul Rose and the team also visit the remains of a Roman shipwreck and, under the cover of night, dive the Straits of Messina, hoping to find and film the sixgill shark - one of the largest predatory sharks in the world.(n)

programme.title: Hunters of the South Seas
programme.desc: Writer and explorer Will Millard heads to the Indonesian village of Lamalera, which is one of the Coral Triangle's most notorious communities as the inhabitants have survived for centuries by hunting manta rays, dolphins, sharks and whales. Using hand-thrown harpoons, the fisherman are the last people on earth who continue to hunt whales in this traditional manner and Will goes out to sea with them to witness their hunts first-hand, testing his Western values to the limit.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: The lives of creatures that are dangerous on land.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The team explores the Arctic Ocean, one of the most hostile environments on Earth, yet one that plays a crucial part in controlling the climate of the planet. Paul Rose and the crew dive beneath the polar ice cap to examine how the ice, the dominant feature of the ocean, is shrinking and how this could affect the rest of the world. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age Giants
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explains what the remains of mammals reveal about how they fared in cold climates. In Transylvanian caves, she discovers evidence of a conflict between a cave bear and a lion, both of which became victims of a deep freeze that swept across Europe, while in Siberia she finds that the well-preserved remains of a female woolly rhinoceros demonstrate it was perfectly evolved to face the bitter conditions in Yakutsk - the coldest city on Earth. Alice also travels to a Jersey cave, where archaeological findings shed light on how Ice Age human beings and Neanderthals fashioned stone tools to hunt mammoths.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall joins Terry Nutkins to learn how dangerous the otter is, before he sets out to locate the UK's largest spider and track down a peregrine falcon.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: The team heads north to Alaska, where days and nights of freezing weather must be endured to catch a glimpse of a wolverine. Some cheeky Arctic foxes are also spotted, and Steve Backshall resolves not to leave the state until he has seen a grizzly bear.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Wildlife series examining the challenges predators face as they stalk their prey, and revealing how it is far more common for hunts to end in failure. The first episode demonstrates how leopards use stealth and concealment to get close to their prey, while African wild dogs have to work as a team. The programme also features footage of killer whales, which rely on their intelligence, Nile crocodiles that can wait years between meals, spiders able to spin 25 foot webs and amur falcons, which travel 16,000 miles every year to hunt insects. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The team explores the Arctic Ocean, one of the most hostile environments on Earth, yet one that plays a crucial part in controlling the climate of the planet. Paul Rose and the crew dive beneath the polar ice cap to examine how the ice, the dominant feature of the ocean, is shrinking and how this could affect the rest of the world. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Hunters of the South Seas
programme.desc: Will Millard explores the Coral Triangle in the western Pacific, interacting with indigenous communities to learn how they have thrived in spite of their extreme isolation. In the village of Sampela, home to 1,500 Bajau people, Will lives with spear fisherman Kabei and his family in their small stilt house. He witnesses the Bajau's breathtaking skills in the water, learns how Kabei hasn't set foot on dry land for three years, and looks at what the future holds for this remarkable community.(n)

programme.title: Tornado Alley
programme.desc: Footage of the EF5 tornado that struck Joplin, Missouri, and the dramatic moments captured by those who survived.(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: Shelley is living a carefree life until a rival gets her tossed out of the Playboy Mansion. With nowhere to go, fate delivers her to the sorority girls from Zeta Alpha Zeta. Unless they can sign a new pledge class, the seven socially clueless women will lose their house to the scheming girls of Phi Iota Mu. In order to accomplish their goal, they need Shelley to teach them the ways of makeup and men at the same time, Shelley needs some of what the Zetas have: a sense of individuality. The combination leads all the girls to learn how to stop pretending and start being themselves(n)

programme.title: John Tucker Must Die
programme.desc: In this romantic comedy with an edge, the good-looking star of a high-school basketball squad is in for a rude awakening when a trio of teen girls team up to bring him and his two-timing ways to justice(n)

programme.title: Frankie and Johnny
programme.desc: Al Pacino stars as Johnny, who has just been released from prison and gets a job in a café beside waitress Frankie. Frankie is a loner but Johnny is determined that their romance will blossom(n)

programme.title: Concussion
programme.desc: This sports-drama centers on the research conducted by forensic neuropathologist that raised public awareness about Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy resulting from such high-impact sports as professional football(n)

programme.title: My Best Friend's Wedding
programme.desc: A woman realizes that friends can be lovers, but now has to convince the friend in question in this romantic comedy. Michael O'Neal (Dermot Mulroney) and Julianne Potter (Julia Roberts) were romantically involved in college, and after breaking up, they have managed to remain close friends. For years, Julianne and Michael have had a pledge that if both were single when they turned 28, they would get married. Shortly before her 28th birthday, Julianne is lamenting the sad state of her love life when she gets a call from Michael, who announces that he has important news. Julianne is convinced that Michael is going to ask her to marry him, and she is crestfallen when he announces that he's engaged to Kimmy Wallace (Cameron Diaz). Kimmy seems like the perfect woman for Michael; she's sweet, pretty, bright, and adores Michael, and her wealthy family is just as fond of him as she is. But now that Julianne has realized how much she loves Michael, she's not about to give him up without a fight -- and isn't afraid to fight dirty. Julianne's uneasy ally in the battle for Michael's affections is her friend and editor George Downes (Rupert Everett), a cheerfully out-of-the-closet homosexual who is not prepared when Julianne asks him to pose as her boyfriend(n)

programme.title: John Tucker Must Die
programme.desc: In this romantic comedy with an edge, the good-looking star of a high-school basketball squad is in for a rude awakening when a trio of teen girls team up to bring him and his two-timing ways to justice(n)

programme.title: The Living Daylights
programme.desc: In this instalment of the James Bond series, Agent 007 is assigned to protect a Russian defector from the KGB. When the defection proves to be an elaborate ploy, Bond woos her anyway, and together they follow a trail to a crooked American arms dealer supplying weapons to Afghanistan(n)

programme.title: Concussion
programme.desc: This sports-drama centers on the research conducted by forensic neuropathologist that raised public awareness about Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy resulting from such high-impact sports as professional football(n)

programme.title: A View to a Kill
programme.desc: Spy drama in which James Bond is assigned to foil a wealthy industrialist's plot to destroy California's Silicon Valley and corner the world's microchip market. After joining forces with a seismologist, 007 races against time to stop the detonation of explosives in the valley(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: The Night of the Crash. In the Season 3 premiere, the clan deals with the loss of a family member(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: The Ritual. In the aftermath of the tragedy, the Calloways and Vaughns comfort one another(n)

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Big-budget remake of the 1968 sci-fi classic following the adventures of a daring astronaut who crash-lands on a planet dominated by intelligent, talking apes. With the help of a chimpanzee activist and a growing band of rebel humans, he forms a resistance movement to liberate mankind from their simian oppressors(n)

programme.title: Meet Wally Sparks
programme.desc: Old-school comic Rodney "I get no respect" Dangerfield headlines this broad-based comedy satire of trashy '90s-style television talk-shows. He plays the title host of an afternoon show that has become so sleazy that all but his most die-hard fans have stopped watching. Studio executive Lenny Spencer (Burt Reynolds) is so disgusted, that he gives Sparks one week to improve the ratings or else. To this end, Sparks attends a special reception hosted by his arch nemesis, ultra-conservative Governor Floyd Preston (David Ogden Stiers)(n)

programme.title: The Object of My Affection
programme.desc: An appealing cast recommends this charming romantic comedy. Jennifer Aniston plays a pregnant social worker who asks her gay best friend (Paul Rudd) to help raise the child. Problems arise when she falls for her gay pal---and he falls for another man. Alan Alda, Nigel Hawthorne, John Pankow, Allison Janney, Tim Daly(n)

programme.title: Mommie Dearest
programme.desc: Based on Christina Crawford's memoirs about her Hollywood upbringing and her mother Joan Crawford's hang-ups, the film depicts the abuse and trauma suffered by Christina(n)

programme.title: Bolt
programme.desc: Thanks to his starring role on a hit television show, Bolt the pooch has become a household name. But Bolt has bought into his own heroic image, now believing that he really possesses the super-canine powers of his fictional television series(n)

programme.title: Robots
programme.desc: Young droid Rodney comes to Robot City to work for his inventor hero Bigweld. But he finds himself leading a revolution against corporate tyrant Ratchet, who intends to replace the creaky population with shiny new upgrades(n)

programme.title: Made of Honor
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a man who, after ten years of platonic friendship with a woman, realises he is in love with her - only to discover she is getting married before he is able to confess his true feelings. To win her over, he agrees to be her 'maid' of honour at the wedding he now wants to sabotage(n)

programme.title: Sweet Home Alabama
programme.desc: A fashion designer is torn between marrying a wealthy New Yorker and going back to her hubby in Alabama. She heads south to finalise her divorce, but the more time she spends with her old flame, the more she feels sparks flying between them again(n)

programme.title: The Man with the Golden Gun
programme.desc: Spy drama in which James Bond finds himself the target of a charismatic assassin. When a bullet arrives at the headquarters of British Intelligence with '007' engraved on it, it is believed that Bond will be the next victim of an international hit man. The disappearance of a solar device that can harness the sun's radiation is soon linked to the case and Bond is hurled into a deadly game of cat-and-mouse(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: The Thank-You Note. Reggie and Missy debate the importance of manners and social etiquette after meeting a wealthy Atlanta couple(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: The Age of Umbrage. When Cam's words during an interview are taken out of context, the result is a scandal that envelops the whole family(n)

programme.title: Sweet Home Alabama
programme.desc: A fashion designer is torn between marrying a wealthy New Yorker and going back to her hubby in Alabama. She heads south to finalise her divorce, but the more time she spends with her old flame, the more she feels sparks flying between them again(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Guy
programme.desc: A successful lobbyist jumps into a new relationship shortly after breaking up with her noncommittal boyfriend. But when her ex resurfaces she soon realizes that one of the two men is not who he appears to be(n)

programme.title: Freaks of Nature
programme.desc: A town full of humans, zombies, and vampires living in coexistence are thrust into an all-out war when aliens invade. Now, three teens must defeat the newest visitors to restore the peace(n)

programme.title: Best of the Best 3: No Turning Back
programme.desc: The action series continues, as Tommy Lee takes on a group of neo-Nazis in the American heartland(n)

programme.title: Three Days of the Condor
programme.desc: A low-level CIA worker returns from lunch to find all his colleagues have been assassinated and goes on the run as he tries to discover who ordered the killings. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: This sequel to Speed sees Sandra Bullock back and Jan de Be Bont directing but with Jason Patric taking over the Keanu Reeves role. The pair are an item and decide on a romantic cruise to the Caribbean. Unfortunately, also aboard the cruise liner are a gathering of diamond merchants, complete with their wares and arch-villain Willem Defoe, who plans to steal their merchandise. Unlike the original Speed, where the trick was that the bus would explode if it slowed down, this time, speed is of the essence - the plan is to ram the ship into dry land and, in the mayhem, escape with the loot. Bullock and Patric are perfect as the dynamic duo who save the day and the ocean-going scenario allows for more spectacular special effects than the original(n)

programme.title: The Alamo
programme.desc: John Wayne and Richard Widmark star in this historical film spectacular about the attack by Mexican troops on the Alamo(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp's Revenge
programme.desc: Wyatt Earp assembles a posse to track down the men responsible for murdering his wife(n)

programme.title: Man of Tai Chi
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves' directorial debut follows villainous Hong Kong fight-club overlord Donaka Mark. He learns that Chen (Tiger Hu Chen) is an elusive martial artist who can use tai chi to beat adversaries to a pulp and recruits the fighter for web-streamed death matches(n)

programme.title: Freaks of Nature
programme.desc: A town full of humans, zombies, and vampires living in coexistence are thrust into an all-out war when aliens invade. Now, three teens must defeat the newest visitors to restore the peace(n)

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: This sequel to Speed sees Sandra Bullock back and Jan de Be Bont directing but with Jason Patric taking over the Keanu Reeves role. The pair are an item and decide on a romantic cruise to the Caribbean. Unfortunately, also aboard the cruise liner are a gathering of diamond merchants, complete with their wares and arch-villain Willem Defoe, who plans to steal their merchandise. Unlike the original Speed, where the trick was that the bus would explode if it slowed down, this time, speed is of the essence - the plan is to ram the ship into dry land and, in the mayhem, escape with the loot. Bullock and Patric are perfect as the dynamic duo who save the day and the ocean-going scenario allows for more spectacular special effects than the original(n)

programme.title: Kung Fu Hustle
programme.desc: Director Stephen Chow made his name in this country with the deliriously wonderful Shaolin Soccer and Kung Fu Hustle continues his love of comedy kung-fu films. Set in pre-revolutionary China, Chow plays Sing, a street hustler who makes the mistake of pretending to be a member of the notorious Axe gang. He becomes caught up in a war between the gang and the residents of Pig Sty Alley, which the gang want to take over. Little do they know that two of the Alley's residents are retired martial arts experts and soon the fists and feet are flying in knockabout fights that owe as much to Kill Bill (some of the wire work is done by Yuen Wo Ping, who worked on Tarantino's film) as they do to classic Hollywood silent comedies. Film fans can enjoy Chow's references to films ranging from Top Hat to The Shining while the rest can just enjoy a wildly entertaining romp. In Cantonese with English subtitles(n)

programme.title: Man of Tai Chi
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves' directorial debut follows villainous Hong Kong fight-club overlord Donaka Mark. He learns that Chen (Tiger Hu Chen) is an elusive martial artist who can use tai chi to beat adversaries to a pulp and recruits the fighter for web-streamed death matches(n)

programme.title: Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai
programme.desc: Ghost Dog lives in a shack on the roof of a disused building. He lives his life according to the Hagakure: The Way Of The Samurai. He is employed by a small-time gangster family and when they betray him, he sets out for revenge..(n)

programme.title: American Ninja 2: The Confrontation
programme.desc: Michael Dudikoff and Steve James stalk a drug kingpin who preys on marines. Larry Poindexter. Burke: Gary Conway(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Ninja
programme.desc: Sho Kosugi plays Cho, a highly-accomplished ninja master who has sworn off his ninja ways and is living in L.A. Trouble follows him, however, because a bunch of ninja ne'er-do-wells threaten to kill his few family members and he must defend them. He takes a bunch of bad guys on and eradicates them(n)

programme.title: Kill Me Again
programme.desc: John Dahl's clever and compelling hommage to film noir starring Joanne Whalley-Kilmer as a contemporary femme fatale who, having robbed the Mafia and double-crossed her lover Michael Madsen, pays down-on-his-luck private eye Val Kilmer to fake her death(n)

programme.title: Men at Work
programme.desc: Sanitation workers witness an altercation through a telescope and find a city official's body in the trash at the same location the next day; they fear being implicated and try to solve the case themselves(n)

programme.title: Bats
programme.desc: Beware of what goes "bump" (and "squeak" and "flap flap flap") in the night. Dr. Sheila Casper (Dina Meyer) is a respected zoologist dispatched by the government to Gallup, TX, a small community suffering from an unusual number of reported bat attacks. Casper finds this news puzzling, since bats are generally placid creatures who avoid contact with humans. The local sheriff, Emmett Kimsey (Lou Diamond Phillips), assures Casper that the reports are on the level and that something needs to be done about swarms of aggressive bats so thick they blot out the moon. Caspar and Kimsey discover that a new breed of genetically altered bats have escaped from a research facility and taken up residence in a cave near Gallup -- but the nocturnal bloodsuckers have no intention of leaving as quickly as they arrived. Bats was written by John Logan, who had two other projects hit the screen within a few months of Bats' release: Oliver Stone's Any Given Sunday and Ridley Scott's Gladiator. The supporting cast includes Leon and Bob Gunton(n)

programme.title: The Closer

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the Secretary of the Navy, learns her daughter has been kidnapped, and the NCIS crew teams up with the FBI to track the case, determine a motive and bring the abducted girl home. Meanwhile, McGee's childhood friend, NCIS Special Agent Valerie Page, arrives in town to assist with advanced tactics training. Naval crime drama, guest starring Leslie Hope and Christina Chang.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team looks into a raid on a naval base, and Dr Cyril Taft - the surgeon who saved Gibbs' life - experiences the thrill of assisting on an investigation. Assigned to treat Gibbs' suspect, Taft manages to uncover evidence that may prove crucial to solving the case. Meanwhile, DiNozzo pays his old flame Jeanne Benoit a visit as he chases a lead involving doctors in Sudan. Guest starring John Cryer and Scottie Thompson.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk Goes to the Ball Game.
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of a wealthy executive quickly reveals that the victim may not have been the assassin's intended target. Adrian is led to a baseball game as he gradually pieces the puzzle together. Detective drama, starring Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk Goes to the Circus.
programme.desc: Stottlemeyer suspects a circus animal trainer is responsible for the murder of an unpopular ringmaster - but Adrian focuses his investigation on the victim's ex-wife, a trapeze artist who is also a sharpshooter. Detective drama, starring Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and the team investigate the death of a man who was the prime suspect in the murder of two girls 10 years earlier, prompting a detective to come out of retirement to help with the case. Crime drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: New evidence associated with the murder of a homeopathist comes to light, prompting Brenda to revisit the case. Meanwhile, the detective's family pays a surprise visit.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A day spent working on a cut-and-dried case leaves the team free to spend some time away from work, and while McGee and Delilah argue over the importance of keeping shop-talk to a minimum, DiNozzo ends up boring his dinner date with crime-solving tales. However, the agents' personal plans are all interrupted as, one-by-one, they realise errors have been made in closing their latest investigation. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An American couple are attacked in Iraq, in the very same spot a group of US Special Ops snipers were ambushed six months earlier. Determined to get to the bottom of the case, Gibbs is forced to speak to Aaron Davis, the only survivor of the first assault, who is now struggling through PTSD at the Walter Reed Medical Center. The 300th episode of the military crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: False Flag
programme.desc: A new video emerges in which the Iranian Defence Minister claims to have defected, rather than being kidnapped, but the Shin Bet investigators remain unconvinced. In Hebrew.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Agent Carter
programme.desc: Peggy tries to steal one of Howard's inventions from the SSR, and Dooley goes to Germany to interrogate a Nazi war criminal who reveals the truth behind a massacre during the war.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois causes Peter some distress when she tells him about her dinner date with former boyfriend Ross Fishman, his wife Pam, and their son Ben. Ross brags about their family vacations and that they plan to climb Mount Everest, so Peter decides the Griffins will also make the undertaking. When they return home, he realises his folly and asks Lois to make up an excuse to bail out.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The Griffins receive a letter from the Nielsen Company telling them they have been selected to have their television viewing habits monitored. Tom Tucker comes to the door and asks Peter for some ideas to change the format of the news show, and the ludicrous suggestions include the anchorman shaving off his moustache and wearing a jester hat.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Snot is rejected after professing his love for Hayley, so Roger decides to give him a new love interest - by pretending to be Steve's female cousin. Meanwhile, Stan tries to live like a gentleman of the 1960s, complete with dark suits and dry martinis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan and Francine argue over how to redecorate their home, and end up splitting the house down the middle and trying to live without each other - but the plan leads to disaster for the whole family.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Quahog's local news station reports Earth will be destroyed by a black hole within 24 hours, and the town's residents respond by shedding their inhibitions in an effort to live their last day to the full.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian and Stewie are accidentally locked inside a bank vault for a weekend in the 150th episode of the popular adult animation, and their situation goes from bad to worse when Brian reveals his plans for the future.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan saves Roger's life, but the pair disagree over the chain of events leading to the rescue, resulting in the alien attempting to make a fresh start. Meanwhile, Steve becomes power-hungry when he is given the job of making announcements over the school's PA system.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan tries to prove he is the alpha male at the Smith house when Steve challenges him for family dominance, while Hayley and Jeff seek marriage counselling after their honeymoon period wears off.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian wins tickets to a Celine Dion concert in Las Vegas, but as he and Stewie prepare to travel, the tot tries out his new teleportation machine. Stewie believes the machine has not worked, but instead he has accidentally duplicated himself and Brian, with one pair going to the show, and the other transported elsewhere.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Joe cheats on Bonnie following some bad advice from Peter, but Lois forces her husband to get the pair back together when Bonnie insists on getting a divorce. Peter is also reunited with an old foe.(n)

programme.desc: Stan begins playing golf with Senator Buckingham in a bid to advance in the CIA, but Roger accidentally sells the politician's daughter to a drug lord, which leaves Stan having to choose between his family and his career.(n)

programme.desc: Brenda gets more than she bargained for when a container holding human remains is found, and resorts to new tactics to enable her team to find the killer. Meanwhile, the detective's niece stirs up trouble. Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.desc: Brenda causes conflict with Fritz when she involves her niece in the investigation of a school shooting that left one person dead and another critically injured. Meanwhile, Provenza makes a life-changing decision. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Navy Public Affairs Officer is killed, and when the team takes up the case, both the man's wife and his mistress emerge as potential suspects. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart the General. Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright) makes the mistake of trying to protect a batch of cupcakes Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith) made for her teacher from schoolyard bully and thug in training Nelson (voice of Cartwright). Nelson gives Bart a beating, and promises more of the same; Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) suggests that Bart try to reason with the bully, while Homer (voice of Dan Castellaneta) tells his son that fighting dirty is the only answer. Neither strategy seems to work, so Bart turns to Grampa Simpson (voice of Castellaneta) for advice. With the help of Herman (voice of Harry Shearer), the mildly insane owner of a store specializing in military relics, Bart and Grampa organize his fellow fourth graders into an army and orchestrate an all-out water-balloon war against Nelson and his fellow bullies. "Bart the General" was first aired on February 4, 1990(n)

programme.title: One Fine Day

The pair agree to take it in turns to babysit while struggling to stick to their hectic schedules - but during the course of the day their feelings for each other blossom unexpectedly. Romantic comedy, starring George Clooney, Michelle Pfeiffer, Charles Durning and Mae Whitman.(n)

programme.desc: Two soldiers return home to the Scottish port town after finishing their tour of duty in Afghanistan. While they struggle to adjust to life as civilians, the parents of one of the squaddies prepare to celebrate their 30th anniversary in style. Musical featuring songs by the Proclaimers, starring George MacKay, Kevin Guthrie, Peter Mullan and Jane Horrocks.(n)

Animated comedy, with the voices of Woody Allen, Sharon Stone, Gene Hackman and Sylvester Stallone.(n)

programme.title: Big Business
programme.desc: The first-born babies in two sets of identical twins are mixed up at birth by a short-sighted nurse, leading to their being raised in very different social circles. In later life, one pair, brought up in a poor mining town, visits New York to challenge a powerful conglomerate - only to find their respective siblings are in charge of the company. Comedy, starring Bette Midler and Lily Tomlin in dual roles alongside Fred Ward and Edward Herrmann.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty

With Kristen Wiig, Adam Scott and Shirley MacLaine.(n)

programme.title: All Is Lost

With few supplies and the navigation and radio equipment destroyed, he is forced to use old-fashioned methods to get to safety - but his journey brings him into the path of a tempest. Thriller, starring Robert Redford.(n)

programme.title: Bad Teacher

A wealthy substitute seems like a suitable candidate, but she has a rival for his attention in a squeaky-clean colleague. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Justin Timberlake, Jason Segel and Lucy Punch.(n)

programme.title: The Lovely Bones

She watches over her family, as her parents struggle to cope in the face of their loss and her sister seeks to identify the killer - who, having covered his tracks, is preparing to strike again. Peter Jackson's fantasy drama, starring Saoirse Ronan, Rachel Weisz, Mark Wahlberg, Stanley Tucci and Susan Sarandon.(n)

Comedy, with Kenneth Williams, Hattie Jacques, Joan Sims, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey, Shirley Eaton and Leslie Phillips.(n)

The hermit tells the story of a grumpy forest creature who tried to stop him destroying the trees, and inspires the youngster to undo the damage that has been done. Animated fantasy based on the children's book, with the voices of Danny DeVito, Zac Efron and Ed Helms.(n)

Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on France
programme.desc: The chef travels to the coastal town of Concarneau in Brittany, France, where he cooks chicken roasted with cider and served with stuffed artichokes, plus a Breton apple flan.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on France
programme.desc: Globetrotting chef Keith Floyd retraces his tour of France, taking another look at some of the ingredients he found in each region, including Provence, Perigord, Burgundy and Alsace.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the best food that summer has to offer, rustling up dishes using the finest available seasonal produce. In the first episode, he visits a local farm that produces welfare-friendly animals, exploring the reasons why members of the British public often feel uneasy about eating veal. He also visits Manchester to extol the success of land-linking website Landshare.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the last programme of knockout week, the second group of five chefs face two tough tests. First they work together to cook a three-course fine dining lunch for ex-England captain Mike Gatting and his guests at Lord's cricket ground. They have to build their menu around mackerel, rabbit, apples and pears - and teamwork will be key as they to plan, execute and transport their dishes to the table. They then return to the MasterChef kitchen to produce a showstopper dish in just 90 minutes - hoping it will be enough to book their place in the semi-finals. As ever, deciding their fates will be no-nonsense judges Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: The young cooks battle for a place in the semi-finals, demonstrating their technical skills by following a chocolate brownie recipe. They also prepare Halloween-themed biscuits. Presented by Aaron Craze, with judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by fellow chef Richard Corrigan for a discussion on the unsung and neglected produce in the British larder. The Irishman champions the cause of offal, but has his work cut out persuading Tom that kidneys are ever worth the effort, while the host tries to revive the profile of hake by cooking the fish in a button mushroom sauce. Plus, resident drinks expert Joe Wadsack brings a German red wine to the table and Fast Show star Arabella Weir gets the inside track on why a good kitchen knife should last a lifetime.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Great Britain
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver arrives in the West Country, and decides to look beyond the usual fare of pasties, Cheddar and cider to find alternative dishes. In Bristol, he visits a traditional Jamaican chef, and joins radio DJ Jules Davis to sample her mother's Guyanese specialities. He also goes foraging for mushrooms, prepares an apple pepperpot pudding using Caribbean spices, and cooks a centuries-old recipe for Bath chaps - otherwise known as pigs' cheeks.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Gourmet Escape
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal travels to Western Australia, looking for high-quality ingredients and enjoying the acclaimed Margaret River Gourmet Escape food and wine festival.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a quick meal of steak Indian-style, with spinach and paneer salad, naan bread and mango dessert.(n)

programme.title: Nigella Bites
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson rustles up a selection of TV dinners for those occasions when time is of the essence, including Thai yellow pumpkin and seafood curry, linguine with garlic oil and pancetta, and salt and pepper squid.(n)

programme.title: Two Fat Ladies
programme.desc: Corpulent cooks Clarissa Dickson Wright and Jennifer Paterson pack their utensils in their rucksacks and set off to Kielder Forest where they feed a troop of hungry scouts. The menu includes shooters' sandwich, frittata with tomatoes, onions and basil, and self-caught trout - all prepared using a custom-made underground stove.(n)

programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal travels to Western Australia, looking for high-quality ingredients and enjoying the acclaimed Margaret River Gourmet Escape food and wine festival.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a quick meal of steak Indian-style, with spinach and paneer salad, naan bread and mango dessert.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by fellow chef Richard Corrigan for a discussion on the unsung and neglected produce in the British larder. The Irishman champions the cause of offal, but has his work cut out persuading Tom that kidneys are ever worth the effort, while the host tries to revive the profile of hake by cooking the fish in a button mushroom sauce. Plus, resident drinks expert Joe Wadsack brings a German red wine to the table and Fast Show star Arabella Weir gets the inside track on why a good kitchen knife should last a lifetime.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: The young cooks battle for a place in the semi-finals, demonstrating their technical skills by following a chocolate brownie recipe. They also prepare Halloween-themed biscuits. Presented by Aaron Craze, with judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the last programme of knockout week, the second group of five chefs face two tough tests. First they work together to cook a three-course fine dining lunch for ex-England captain Mike Gatting and his guests at Lord's cricket ground. They have to build their menu around mackerel, rabbit, apples and pears - and teamwork will be key as they to plan, execute and transport their dishes to the table. They then return to the MasterChef kitchen to produce a showstopper dish in just 90 minutes - hoping it will be enough to book their place in the semi-finals. As ever, deciding their fates will be no-nonsense judges Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti.(n)

programme.title: Nigella Bites
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson rustles up a selection of TV dinners for those occasions when time is of the essence, including Thai yellow pumpkin and seafood curry, linguine with garlic oil and pancetta, and salt and pepper squid.(n)

programme.title: Two Fat Ladies
programme.desc: Corpulent cooks Clarissa Dickson Wright and Jennifer Paterson pack their utensils in their rucksacks and set off to Kielder Forest where they feed a troop of hungry scouts. The menu includes shooters' sandwich, frittata with tomatoes, onions and basil, and self-caught trout - all prepared using a custom-made underground stove.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Great Britain
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver arrives in the West Country, and decides to look beyond the usual fare of pasties, Cheddar and cider to find alternative dishes. In Bristol, he visits a traditional Jamaican chef, and joins radio DJ Jules Davis to sample her mother's Guyanese specialities. He also goes foraging for mushrooms, prepares an apple pepperpot pudding using Caribbean spices, and cooks a centuries-old recipe for Bath chaps - otherwise known as pigs' cheeks.(n)

programme.title: Matt Tebbutt's South Africa
programme.desc: New series. The chef begins his exploration of South African food in sizzling style, finding out about the ?braai' method of grilling outdoors and firing up some feasts.(n)

programme.title: Gizzi Erskine Seoul Food
programme.desc: New series. The chef showcases the best in South Korean food. Here, she learns the secrets of a traditional ingredient that almost defines Korean cooking.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the best food that summer has to offer, rustling up dishes using the finest available seasonal produce. In the first episode, he visits a local farm that produces welfare-friendly animals, exploring the reasons why members of the British public often feel uneasy about eating veal. He also visits Manchester to extol the success of land-linking website Landshare.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Britain and Ireland
programme.desc: Keith Floyd samples the traditional fare of Ulster, cooking beef in Guinness stout with oysters, and paying a visit to the Old Bushmills Distillery. He also takes part in the Taste of Ulster culinary contest, where he faces stiff competition in the form of Northern Ireland's best chefs, and learns the art of making potato bread at the Ulster Folk Museum.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and Tim Maddams introduce a `leftovers night' at the canteen, turning a range of foods destined for the compost heap into new dishes including gnocchi, fish canapes and puddings made from breadcrumbs. A visit to Portland Young Offender Institution reveals the success of its vegetable-growing programme, and a nursery-school teacher is shown how to bake bread.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first two semi-finalists battle it out for a place in finals week. Then the pair return to cook the most important two courses of their careers for Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by Angela Hartnett for a discussion on how to make delicious, high-quality food on a tight budget, with the chef and restaurateur pitting her vanilla custard tart against the host's beef and blue cheese risotto. Plus, Oliver Peyton discovers how to spice up his life on the cheap, Kimberley Wilson lifts the lid on how to make great grub from waste food, and drinks expert Joe Wadsack selects the best cut-price wine.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Great Britain
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver concludes his nationwide culinary tour by visiting the west of Scotland, taking in Glasgow's oldest restaurant to discover how haggis is being given a West Indian twist. Fisherman Hector Stewart invites the chef to join him scallop-fishing in the Clyde, and in Striven, he uses Arbroath smokie and rope-grown mussels to create a Scottish version of a classic French dish. He also helps at a pheasant shoot, and uses local game to prepare an ambitious Italian recipe.(n)

But when Anna's behavior becomes increasingly unhinged, eldest sibling Jacob (Joshua Rush) grows suspicious and discovers that she's actually an imposter named Emelie who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child. programme.title: Making of 'Jackie'
programme.desc: A look at "Jackie," a 2016 drama about former first lady Jacqueline Onassis from her time in the White House to the aftermath of the assassination of her husband, President John F. Kennedy, in 1963. The film stars Natalie Portman, Greta Gerwig and Peter Sarsgaard, and is directed by Pablo Larraín(n)

programme.title: Rails & Ties
programme.desc: Kevin Bacon, Marcia Gay Harden, and Miles Heizer star in director Alison Eastwood's tale of two families locked into an emotional -- and physical -- collision course. There once was a time when Tom and Megan Stark had all the time in the world to take their dream vacation and start a family, but these days the couple's marriage is suffering and their time appears to be running short. Megan has been diagnosed with a potentially terminal illness, and when the prospect of losing his wife becomes too much to bear, railroad engineer Tom seeks escape in his work. On the tracks Tom is in control; all the routes are predetermined and he knows he'll eventually arrive at his destination. But sometimes even the most predictable events can go suddenly awry, and when Tom's train hits a car that was parked on the tracks by a suicidal mother, his life is plunged into ruin. While there was no way that Tom could have possibly stopped the train on time, the grieving conductor's woes are suddenly compounded upon realizing that he may lose his job because of the accident. Not only that, but the deceased woman's son, Davey, is consumed by the guilt that he could do nothing to prevent the accident, and he now places the blame for his mother's death squarely on Tom. But not all sad stories have to end in tragedy, and perhaps in the aftermath of this fateful accident Megan could receive a second chance at fulfilling her dreams, Tom could learn to open his heart before he is consumed by bitterness, and Davey could finally learn the true meaning of family(n)

programme.title: Down With Love
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Ewan McGregor, Renée Zellweger and David Hyde Pierce. Zellweger and McGregor are on top form in this spoof of the sort of 60s sex comedies that would pair Rock Hudson and Doris Day. She's a best-selling author who advocates that her female readership ditch ideas of love and romance for a more guilt-free approach to sensual pleasures. He's the hip journalist and ladies' man out to prove her wrong(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg stars in Emile Ardolino's comedy thriller as Deloris Van Cartier, a lounge singer at a casino managed by her lover VInce LaRocca. He's also a drugs baron and when she accidentally interrupts him in the process of rubbing out a stool pigeon, she has to run for her life. To keep her safe until LaRocca can be charged, the police arrange for her to become Sister Mary Clarence at a nunnery overseen by stern Mother Superior. But you can't keep a good singer down and Sister Mary has soon so successfully invigorated the choir with her musical talent that the church is packed - and there is even a call from Rome for a Papal performance. Unfortunately, thanks to an inside man in the police department, LaRocca learns of her whereabouts and sets out to prevent her testifying; can her new found friends, the nuns, protect her?(n)
