programme.desc: United Archives. Hard to live up to the first meeting between these teams, nevertheless United had their sights on equalling Aston Villa and Spurs' record of seven FA Cup wins.(n)

programme.title: Goals on Film: 1998/99
programme.desc: Relive every United goal as the Reds completed a famous treble and were crowned Premiership, FA Cup and European champions all in the same season.(n)

programme.title: Marathon Bet US Challenge
programme.desc: Five United legends take on the Marathon Bet US Challenge. David May, Mickey Thomas, Gary Pallister, Quinton Fortune and Denis Irwin compete to see who is the ultimate legend at US Sports.(n)

programme.title: Eric Harrison's Class of '92
programme.desc: Documentary looking back at the FA Youth Cup Winning side of 1992, which yielded the likes of David Beckham, Gary Neville and Nicky Butt.(n)

programme.title: Div 1: United v Liverpool 88/89
programme.desc: United Archives. A New Year's day classic as these rivals locked horns at Old Trafford. There was nothing to choose between the sides' head-to-head history, both teams had won 39 times.(n)

programme.title: The American Dream: How Football Made It Stateside
programme.desc: Special documentary examining the growth of the beautiful game and United support in the United States of America.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple disagree over where to spend their retirement, with husband Michael hoping to set up home in Derbyshire, where he will be able to indulge his passion for the British countryside. Conversely, his wife Susan would like to spend her time relaxing by a pool in the Spanish sun, and it is left up to Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman to help them decide where to spend their £180,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple with very different ideas of how they want to spend their retirement seek advice from Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman. While husband Tony plans on returning to the Wirral in Merseyside, his wife Karin hopes to move to southern Spain, where her sister has already settled.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Who'd a Thought It in Grafty Green, Kent, where partners Joe Mallett and Alex Rea Baldwin hope to impress their fellow guests. On arrival, Liz and Brian are excited over their two hot tubs, and Jackie and Paul are more than happy with the complimentary champagne. However, Matthew and Liam are underwhelmed by the cleanliness levels.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the New Osborne Hotel in Blackpool on their second night, where proprietor Matthew Bracegirdle and entertainment manager Liam hope their guests feel at home in their family friendly establishment. However, Jackie and Paul are unimpressed by their small room, and Joe and Alex find the cleanliness levels lacking.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Fairy Falls Hotel in Trefriw, Conwy County Borough, where B&B newcomers Jackie and Paul Langshaw hope to impress the other contestants. They take their guests to a local maze in the afternoon and, after an uncomfortable night's sleep for Alex, some of the breakfast orders are misplaced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Husband and wife Liz and Brian Jardine welcome their guests to The Great Trewern B&B, Llandrindod Wells, Powys, where they enjoy the quiet life. Joe and Alex feel far away from it all, but the shared bathroom facilities fail to impress the other guests. At dinner, talk turns to first impressions and it appears it is all water under the bridge for Jackie and Joe, but she remains upset with the feedback Matthew and Liam gave her.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet one final time to find out what they have been paid. Joe Mallett and Alex Rea Baldwin kick things off by confronting Matthew Bracegirdle and Liam Halewood about their comments regarding the cleanliness of their establishment, and Jackie and Paul Langshaw complain about their poor breakfast score.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Cameras follow Tina and Colin as they choose between investing in a house in Yorkshire or taking the plunge and moving to the Alentejo area of Portugal.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman help a couple decide where to purchase their dream B&B. Yvonne is drawn to the Yorkshire Dales, but Omar would prefer a warmer climate in the Algarve, Portugal.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Litlington, Cambridgeshire: There's a Villa Here Somewhere.
programme.desc: The team heads to the Cambridgeshire village of Litlington to search for the remains of what was rumoured to be one of Britain's biggest Roman villas. However, the initial digging site yields little useful evidence, forcing the archaeologists to ask for permission to excavate local residents' gardens, while a team of diggers tackles trees and undergrowth in a nearby copse.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team search for the remains of an Iron Age fort at Dinmore Hill in Herefordshire, but their investigation is hampered when the geophysicists struggle to find target sites for excavating - and heavy rain causes further difficulties. With digging temporarily suspended, the experts discuss the purpose and date of the archaeology, but disagreements soon arise.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Documentary following life at Scott Miller's veterinary practice in Richmond Hill, south-west London, beginning as he tends a cat that has fallen three floors.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a woman who wants to build a shop and a mobile home out of an old horsebox on a budget of just £500, and a couple creating a holiday let from a 1960s milk float. He also visits a remarkable 100ft-long balancing barn and makes plans for a rectangular pod for his tree house in the grounds of Northumberland's Kielder National Park.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Revisited
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to Somerset to see Ed and Vicky Versluys and their cow shed conversion. A year after his last visit and with the house finally complete, Kevin finds out what it's like living in an off-grid home designed for animals.(n)

programme.title: Volatile Earth
programme.desc: The impact of the Great Hurricane of 1780, which killed almost 28,000 people across the Caribbean, and the possibility of another of its kind striking again. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Wildest Weather
programme.desc: Footage of unusual weather conditions recorded in Britain during 2016, and exploring the factors that led to these incidents. The programme features footage recorded by people caught in the middle of floods, super-storms, tornadoes and lightning strikes, as well as a look at how a record level El Nino effect altered Britain's weather.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the ups and downs of family life and how people pull together to get through them. Among the patients is Pam, 53, who is admitted to A&E after suffering a suspected heart attack. There's also a profile of 10-year-old Cora, who is rushed to St George's after being thrown from a horse into the branches of a tree.(n)

programme.title: Volatile Earth
programme.desc: The impact of the Great Hurricane of 1780, which killed almost 28,000 people across the Caribbean, and the possibility of another of its kind striking again. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Wildest Weather
programme.desc: Footage of unusual weather conditions recorded in Britain during 2016, and exploring the factors that led to these incidents. The programme features footage recorded by people caught in the middle of floods, super-storms, tornadoes and lightning strikes, as well as a look at how a record level El Nino effect altered Britain's weather.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr oversees the disputes and deliberations as Sarah Millican and Nick Grimshaw join Jon Richardson, while Ollie Locke and Joe Wilkinson team up with Sean Lock to answer questions about events that fascinate the great British public.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Cameras follow Tina and Colin as they choose between investing in a house in Yorkshire or taking the plunge and moving to the Alentejo area of Portugal.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman help a couple decide where to purchase their dream B&B. Yvonne is drawn to the Yorkshire Dales, but Omar would prefer a warmer climate in the Algarve, Portugal.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit is to the 12th-century Oxenham Arms, Devon, where owners Simon and Lyn Powell hope to kick-off the competition in style. The guests participate in broom dancing and after throwing some moves, the hosts have fellow contestant John pegged as the one to watch.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Elegant House bed and breakfast in Liverpool on their second night, where host John Brady hopes his unique property will stand out from the crowd. Nikki and David get to grips with the unconventional facilities, and David reveals his background as a hotel inspector - with Amanda making her opinions on the star rating system very clear.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Monmouthshire, where Peter and Amanda Copp want to rope their guests into the world of `glamping' at Hidden Valley Yurts. John has a hairy encounter in his yurt, and the shared bathroom facilities fail to impress David and Nikki. The next morning, the DIY breakfast proves underwhelming for some, while the hosts discover that the great outdoors is not everyone's cup of tea.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Former hotel inspector and owner David Stanbridge and manager Nikki Deans welcome the contestants to the Cley Hall Hotel in Spalding, Lincolnshire. Peter and Amanda are impressed by their room, but Simon and Lyn are unhappy with the state of the carpet. The next morning, the guests decide to put their eight-minute breakfast rule to the test, and some of them have concerns about Nikki's waitressing skills.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts meet for the final time to find out what they've been paid and confront their critics. Simon and Lyn kick off proceedings by demanding answers from John about his disturbed night's sleep, but then find themselves taken to task by David over their cleanliness feedback. However, the former hotel inspector receives his own interrogation from Peter and Amanda, who want to know why he didn't praise their shared bathroom facilities. Tensions run high as the payments are revealed and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman takes Steve and Jackie Parkes to Albufeira, Portugal, where the couple hope to snap up a holiday home, while Laura Hamilton searches for a property in Torquay, Devon, that is suitable for Jackie's elderly parents.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Laura Hamilton search for a second home in the Lake District and Sitges, Spain, on a budget of £250,000 for a pair who want to rent out the property when they are not using it. They try to help Stephen and Stuart decide whether to buy a holiday apartment abroad, or stay in the UK.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team travel to Bedford Purlieus Wood in Cambridgeshire, where a set of Roman building foundations has been spotted poking through the forest floor. Aerial visualisations suggest the area was home to several structures - but the experts' attempts to find out more are hampered as the diggers struggle to get to grips with the cramped woodland environment.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Glendon Hall, Northamptonshire: The Bodies in the Shed.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate the mystery of human skeletons found under outbuildings at Glendon Hall, Northamptonshire. The remains seem to be aligned east to west, prompting the team to wonder whether they have stumbled upon medieval Christian peasant graves - a relic of the lost village of Glendon.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller takes on a challenging hip replacement for a chihuahua and also has to deal with one of the most shocking cases of neglect he has ever seen.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect visits a futuristic home designed to save space, with a double bed rising into the ceiling to reveal the living area beneath, and the kitchen and bathroom cleverly hidden from view. Inspired by these ideas, George and William make progress with their tree house, showing that by folding everything into the walls it is possible to fit all the rooms into a small space. He also meets a couple who are building the ultimate wilderness beach hut.(n)

programme.title: Craft It Yourself
programme.desc: The team tackle an overlooked dining room, using a stylish colour block theme, and Ant Anstead and Clem Green put their chemistry to the test with resin.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: Lambing season starts for the hill-farming Dawson family, while Vanessa and Nigel must decide whether running the Tan Hill Inn, Britain's highest pub, is really for them.(n)

programme.title: Our Guy in India
programme.desc: Guy Martin takes a 1,000-mile journey across India to compete in a race called Rider Mania, the world's largest gathering of Royal Enfield motorbikes. In the first of two programmes, the daredevil rides with a 50-strong biker gang, visits Asia's biggest truck yard and finds himself completely out of his comfort zone.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in New Jersey to help Rose Leone, who spent two years in a coma and came out of hospital to learn her son Michael had run her once-thriving Italian restaurant into the ground. With a menu of more than 126 dishes, the quality of the food is suffering, and even the chefs refuse to eat their own creations.(n)

programme.title: The '80s: The Decade That Made Us
programme.desc: Lift Off. This landmark new series takes viewers back in time to see how the '80s created our modern world. The first episode of this six-part miniseries explores the revolution in personal entertainment brought on by Pac-Man, Sony Walkmans and Jane Fonda's ground-breaking workout video. Apple's Steve Wozniak helps explain how Bill Gates saw the future by selling IBM the rights to use MS-DOS software for a relatively small one-time fee, only to clean up when IBM competitors entered the market and all wanted the same software. The assassination of John Lennon heralded the end of one music era, while a bratty new kid on the block defined a new one - spelt 'MTV'. Revel in the joy of July 1981 in Britain as more than half a million people line the streets of London - and another 750 million tune-in around the globe - to see Prince Charles wed Lady Diana Spencer. And, hear from maverick businessman turned multimedia mogul Richard Branson on how he took Rock 'N Roll to new heights - literally - with the acquisition of his first 747. Sharing their first-hand stories are Darryl DMC McDaniels, Steven Tyler, Jane Fonda, Steve Wozniak, Richard Branson and Princess Diana's private secretary(n)

programme.title: The Wild West
programme.desc: True Grit. Few legends are more significant in the American psyche than that of the Wild West. But for the animals that live in the jagged heart of the great Rocky Mountains, those myths are a savage reality. The mountains of the American West remain an epic stage, and even today, the iconic figures of the Old West have their real life counterparts in the animals that live there. A wolf gang preys on a moose calf and out here, only the strong will survive. Deadly banditos attack prairie dog villagers, and a young grizzly bear goes prospecting, desperate for edible gold. Mountain lions, lone rangers striking out to settle the vast living wilderness, survive by being as wild as the mountains themselves. This is the iconic Wild West as it truly is, as wild now as it was in the glory days of cinematic lore(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor tours the rooms, restaurants and bars where the rich and famous have lived, died and fallen in love, checking in to Bastille's L'Hotel in Paris where Oscar Wilde spent his last days. He travels to New York's Chelsea Hotel, where long-term residents included Mark Twain, Stanley Kubrick, Edith Piaf, Sid Vicious and Robert Mapplethorpe. Richard also heads to the Dorchester in London's Mayfair, where Britt Ekland shares her memories of meeting and falling for Peter Sellers there in 1964.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

Meanwhile, Ronnie is excited at the possibility that her latest case could be a 1960s Mob hit.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: In this edition the actor explores the luxury hotels of Hong Kong. Home to more skyscrapers than any other city, he first checks in to the Mandarin in the financial district, before experiencing the Four Seasons, the only hotel with two Michelin three-star resturants, as well as the timeless Peninsula in Kowloon, which even provides a Rolls-Royce airport taxi service. He ends his stay at the Ritz-Carlton, home to the world's highest swimming pool.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: An actor becomes the victim of an axe murderer and suspicion falls on the studio bosses who could make huge profits from publicity surrounding the tragedy thanks to its similarities with several of their horror pictures. However, when Ronnie returns to the set to look for her mobile phone, she has her own terrifying experience.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: The Reagans rally together to take down the leader of the gang responsible for the death of someone close to them. As Danny attempts to draw the killer out, he turns to the man's girlfriend for help. Meanwhile, Frank is left reeling by a second loss. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Daenerys makes an offer to the Lords of Westeros. Meanwhile, Tyrion worries about his Queen's behaviour and decisions, and Bran has a vision of the Night King's army.(n)

programme.title: Thronecast
programme.desc: Companion show to fantasy drama Game of Thrones, featuring news, highlights of the series and interviews with cast and crew members.(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
programme.desc: American talk show in which British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver presents a satirical look at the biggest news stories, political developments and pop culture events of the previous seven days. The topical series sees the former Daily Show reporter offer his distinct take on a variety of social, political and existential issues facing society.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Daenerys makes an offer to the Lords of Westeros. Meanwhile, Tyrion worries about his Queen's behaviour and decisions, and Bran has a vision of the Night King's army.(n)

programme.title: Real Time with Bill Maher
programme.desc: Comedian Bill Maher invites three guests from different parts of the political spectrum to discuss the week's events.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Ray devises an attempt to save Avi and settle his debts, but FBI agent Frank Barnes detains him before the plan can be executed. Meanwhile, Barnes makes Ray an offer.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Just as Ray thinks his deal with Hector will be his family's salvation, Sonia gives incriminating evidence to Agent Barnes. Meanwhile, Mickey makes a discovery.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As China and Kazahkstan hover on the verge of war, Santos works on his campaign strategy. Ellie prepares for her wedding, while Abbey greets the guests, but President Bartlet is held up by his duties. Carol shows up on the scene, and Josh's job is threatened by disgruntled party loyalists.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The vice presidential debate between Leo McGarry and Ray Sullivan looms but Josh remains unconvinced of his candidate's abilities in the public arena. Meanwhile, Santos visits his family in Texas where his brother threatens to cause a stir.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor discovers some of the hidden extras on offer in the world's most expensive hotels. He goes underground at Paris's George V for a tasting session in its fine wine cellars and catches up with the managing director of London's Goring, who reveals why the hotel has become the unofficial royal choice. At the Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles, Richard talks to a wedding planner who has organised nuptials for celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Nicole Richie and Katy Perry, and he also chats to Kiss bassist Gene Simmons and Cosmopolitan editor-in-chief Joanna Coles.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In the final programme, he discovers how earthquakes wreak so much havoc.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britain's grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The Westins visit Washington, but it appears Doug is harbouring a secret from Liz that many of the other senior staff members already know. Meanwhile, CJ attempts to make a deal with the French in a bid to tackle problems in Sudan, and Josh asks for help with the campaign. Steven Eckholdt guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The White House is thrown into a state of emergency by the threat of an exploding nuclear reactor, which also plunges the presidential campaign into disarray as the candidates struggle to deal with the situation. Meanwhile, Kate monitors the threat of conflict between Russia and China.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Part one of two. The team searches for a mother who has disappeared, leaving her three-year-old son with a babysitter. While it initially appears she cracked under the strain of maintaining two jobs to support herself and her child, further investigation reveals she may have been drawn into the drugs trade as a mule, so Samantha goes undercover in a bid to snare the trafficker who recruited her.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor explores Berlin, visiting the arty Propeller Island City Lodge - a hotel where guests can fulfil their fantasies by sleeping in lion cages, coffins or rotating beds. At the Schlosshotel in affluent Grunewald, cabaret dancer Romy Haag talks to Richard about her affair with David Bowie, who stayed at the hotel while living in the German capital in the 1970s.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The latest opinion polls are released and in the light of the recent nuclear near-disaster, there are surprises all round. President Bartlet continues to monitor the peace in central Asia and considers deploying US troops to the area. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As the election draws nearer, the candidates begin to feel the pressure of what lies ahead. However, things turn ugly when Bruno spots a chance to damage the Santos campaign - leaving Vinick with a tough decision to make. Political drama, starring Alan Alda.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: In a two-part crossover story with drama series Without a Trace, Grissom and the team join forces with FBI agent Jack Malone to investigate the discovery of two bodies in an apartment, and find themselves on the trail of a serial killer. Grissom and Malone track the chief suspect to a casino - only to discover he has already fled, abducting a woman and killing a police officer in the process. Guest starring Anthony LaPaglia, with William Petersen.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Concluding part of the crossover story with CSI: Crime Scene Investigation. Gil Grissom (guest William Petersen) joins the squad to help with the hunt for a serial killer suspected of murdering a boy in Las Vegas who originally went missing from New York.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: An armed robbery results in the death of a police officer and Frank vows to bring the suspect to justice. Tensions run high at home, however, when Erin drops the charges in her capacity as assistant DA and releases the suspect due to a lack of evidence. Jamie is also caught up in the conflict when he and his rookie partner are assigned to protect the suspected cop killer. Tom Selleck stars.(n)

programme.desc: Dale Cooper returns 25 years after his investigation into Laura Palmer's murder. Written by David Lynch and Mark Frost, and starring Kyle MacLachlan.(n)

Meanwhile, Wendell updates the team on his cancer treatment, but makes an indiscretion that could get him fired.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Detective Rush reopens the case of a 17-year-old girl who was murdered the day after giving birth at a home for unmarried mothers in 1964. As the case proceeds, she struggles to find a killer among the hundreds of women who were in the maternity home at the time - and re-examines her relationship with her own mother. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris.(n)

programme.desc: Free runner John breaks his heel after jumping 10ft from a bridge, and a freak accident leaves a woman's ear hanging off.(n)

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: The vicious murder of a college professor calls for Sherlock to apply his deductive skills to the case, while Joan receives an unexpected request for help from an ex-lover. Jonny Lee Miller stars as the modern-day version of Arthur Conan Doyle's brilliant sleuth, with Lucy Liu as his companion Dr Joan Watson.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: As Hotch returns to work following his near-death experience, a woman is found crushed to death under a tomb-like structure in the Utah mountains. The profilers think they've got a ritualistic killer on their hands and the victim's links to a sect seem to confirm their suspicions. Meanwhile, Garcia prepares for her Day of the Dead party and pulls out all the stops to spook her colleagues.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team is summoned to Boston when three men are mugged and strangled to death with garrottes. A desperate thief is the first guess, but Garcia's discovery that none of the victims' stolen credit cards have been used makes the agents wonder if the killer is collecting mementos. Meanwhile, Rossi takes a trip down memory lane after hearing his favourite bar is on the verge of closing down.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Morgan returns to his Chicago roots to investigate a mass murder at an all-night diner. The shooter, a runaway teenager, has been killed at the scene by an off-duty police officer, but CCTV footage reveals he had an accomplice - who could strike again. Digging into the gunman's background for clues, the BAU finds no motive or criminal record. What drove him to kill?.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan re-evaluates her relationship with Booth when Afghanistan war correspondent Hannah Burley pays him a surprise visit, and the duo try to piece together the identities of two people from remains found in a cave. Guest starring Katheryn Winnick (Failure to Launch).(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The new BAU chief cracks the whip on his first day in charge, and the profilers are taken aback by his appointment - none more so than JJ, who has a complicated history with him. Meanwhile, a `surgeon' has been performing lobotomies and leaving his victims alive and unable to communicate, but with no leads, the investigators must change their tactics. Former NYPD Blue star Esai Morales joins the cast.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Hotch gives the agents a scare when he collapses at work and ends up being rushed into surgery, while his colleagues also have the case of a missing teenager to worry about. Abducted by her jailbird father, the team suspects it's an act of revenge for being denied access to his daughter, but the youngster may not be as innocent as she seems.(n)

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: Holmes is recruited to consult on a double homicide, which appears to mirror a killing spree that took place more than a decade ago - freezing out Watson as he tries to dissect the case. Captain Gregson's past comes back to haunt him when a face from the past appears. Modern-day Sherlock Holmes adventure, guest starring Callie Thorne (The Wire), with Jonny Lee Miller and Lucy Liu.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth's rule of thumb is, if CIA agent Danny Beck (guest star Freddie Prinze Jr) is involved, then something underhand is going on, so upon finding him at the home of an Afghan feminist who was recently murdered, his concerns rocket. Danny is tight-lipped about his connection to the victim, but he does confirm that he recruited her to help fight al-Qaeda. Meanwhile, stories about fighting terrorism on the front line give Brennan an appetite for adventure and she decides she wants to work more closely with Booth in the field.(n)

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: The sleuth is called in to investigate when a supposedly impenetrable bank vault is broken into - and as if that were not enough to tax his brain, he also faces a meeting with Joan's family. Modern-day Sherlock Holmes adventure, starring Jonny Lee Miller and Lucy Liu.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Dawson accidentally hits a pedestrian while responding to a call. Casey and Severide continue to investigate the arson case, while Boden attends an important function in New York.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: All the members of a Virginia family are taken into custody to single out a killer following the discovery of two skeletons in their back garden. Away from the investigation, JJ wants to put an end to speculation that she and Cruz are having an affair. With Glynn Turman (House of Lies), L Scott Caldwell (Southland) and Seth Gilliam (The Wire).(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents must determine whether prank calls to the Taffert family home are linked to the abduction of 10-year-old Andrew, or an unrelated practical joke. Tell-tale signs mirror an unsolved kidnapping in Memphis 15 years earlier, requiring the profilers to reopen the old case. Guest starring Doug Savant (Desperate Housewives) and Marika Dominczyk (Brothers & Sisters).(n)

programme.title: What About Bob
programme.desc: A psychiatrist takes on a friend's client, who turns out to be a well-meaning but annoying neurotic barely able to leave his home. The patient is hugely impressed by the consultant's methods, leading him to follow the therapist on holiday, where he unwittingly proceeds to make his life hell while winning over his family. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Richard Dreyfuss, Julie Hagerty and Charlie Korsmo.(n)

programme.title: Pretty Woman
programme.desc: A ruthless millionaire hires a prostitute while on a business trip. Realising she may be useful in helping him keep up a successful appearance, he pays her to accompany him for a week as he associates with the rich and powerful - but falls in love despite their many differences. Romantic comedy, starring Richard Gere and Julia Roberts, with Ralph Bellamy and Laura San Giacomo.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Billy Madison
programme.desc: A lazy twentysomething lives off his wealthy hotel magnate father. When the old man decides to retire, he begins to question whether his layabout son is suitable to take over the family empire and issues a challenge - he must retake 12 years of school in 24 weeks, or lose everything. Comedy, starring Adam Sandler, Bridgette Wilson, Darren McGavin and Bradley Whitford.(n)

programme.title: Grandma
programme.desc: A woman recovering from a break-up receives an unexpected visit from her granddaughter, who desperately needs to raise $600 before the end of the day. They visit a series of old contacts in search of a loan, which leads to long-buried secrets coming to light. Comedy drama, starring Lily Tomlin and Julia Garner.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: Lively teenager Bianca is not allowed to start dating until her man-hating sister Kat does first - but no boy is brave enough to ask her out. However, Bianca's would-be boyfriend thinks he has found the perfect man for the job in the shape of a quirky loner with a mysterious past. Comedy, based on Shakespeare's The Taming of the Shrew, starring Heath Ledger, Julia Stiles, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Larisa Oleynik.(n)

programme.title: Knocked Up
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: A woman who has rarely been without a boyfriend moves to New York following a break-up with her boyfriend. She makes a fun-loving new friend, who introduces her to the city's nightlife and teaches her to enjoy the advantages of being single. Comedy, starring Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Alison Brie and Leslie Mann.(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two estranged sisters are reunited when their parents decide to sell the house they grew up in. They return to the family home to clear out their childhood bedrooms, but with their parents away, seize the chance to relive their teenage years and throw one last wild house party. Comedy, starring Amy Poehler, Tina Fey and Dianne Wiest.(n)
